intro: Sterculia chapelieri, commonly known as the Cape York hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Sterculia chapelieri thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rainforest areas.
